object.description: A colossal gauntlet of masterful composition. Its sheer size is disproportionate for most warriors, only able to be worn on one's forearm as a bracer. A once glossy exterior faded from battle long ago, yet the sturdiness of its make is as resolute as it ever was.
The malachite stone makes you feel at peace with the land.
The azure stone makes you feel ready for any situation.
The dolomite stone makes you feel able to stand against anything.
The ice this item is made of doesn't seem to melt.
A mysterious light emanates from the stone.
It's said that this necklace was created to protect the mortal lover of an old God.

A potion that instantly restores health points.
A lucky shamrock that will make enemies drop more and better loot! Lasts 20 minutes.
A special green brew for Saint Patrick's Day. Heals and invigorates your fighting spirit.
Light armor crafted from the hard-as-steel leafy scales of a Leaf Dragon.
A magic robe woven from enchanted threads of water harvested from a great Water Dragon's body.

effectinfo.name: On Ability Use
effectinfo.description: Heals 100 HP and applies healing for 3 seconds when under 75% HP.

object.description: Battle armor made from Fire Dragon scales, one of the strongest substances this world has ever seen.

effectinfo.name: On Ability Use
effectinfo.description: Deals a burst of 500 damage to enemies within 5 sqrs and poison them for 1000 damage over 5 seconds.

object.description: An ancient weapon imbued with the power of the cosmos.
To quench your pet's thirst!
Fresh cut and steaming hot!
Contains fresh salsa!
Cheesy and delicious.
Goes best with milk!
Super healthy, super delicious, super wrathful!
A hearty classic!
The ultimate deluxe cheeseburger!
The nectar of the gods which holds great power!
Rich in nutrient, can also be used to power electrical devices. Like servers...
Tart and tangy.
Buttery and delicious.
Nice and sweet.
Fresh out of Oryx's kitchen.
A whole Thanksgiving turkey!
Used only by the pirates who would make themselves kings, this cutlass is said to be cursed as each Pirate King seems to be killed rather unexpectedly.
Stuck in the maw of the Son of Arachna, this katana is coated in the creature's poisonous venom. In the hands of the right person, this is a truly deadly weapon.
Fashioned from the finest logs found within the Woodland Labyrinths, this bow uses sharp leaves instead of conventional arrows. Such lightweight ammunition allows for quick movement.
This legendary sword is used to summon the beautiful power of bears.
Eucalyptus can be incredibly effective at looking awesome.
The fabled weapon of the Sauce Boss himself.
Toats sweet robobow bro!
Forged from sunshine, baby smiles, and the sparkle from unicorns.
Battle for the Nexus: Never Forget.
Thought to have been lost to the ages, the wisdom imparted in this tablet will summon a power unrivaled by any modern spell.
An unfathomably powerful sword that absorbs the skulls of enemies and unleashes them with magical energy.
A potion that instantly restores health points.
A potion that instantly restores health points.
A potion that instantly restores health points.
A potion that instantly restores health points.
A potion that instantly restores health points.
A potion that instantly restores health points.
Diamonds are a girl's best friend, they also happen to make for great blades... so shiny!
The unusual shots that this staff fires have been known to bind the hearts of your foes for all eternity, or at least until death do you part.
Harnessing the unusual power of Belladonna's flowers, these shots are beautiful but deadly!
This dagger is said to point in the direction of the one you love. Or intend to stab.\n\nSprite Credits: ngbro
Strung together with the deadly vines of Belladonna.\n\nSprite Credits: nooblegend
This probably doesn't have a chance of making monsters fall in love with you. I mean, I don't think so.
Harbinger of hard-boiled justice.\n\nSprite Credits: Linkshot, Sues, and Wylem.
A staff that glows with the warmth and color of the rising sun.
A spell that blasts enemies with the fiery force of a thousand suns.
A ceremonial robe worn by ritual leaders during the celebration of the Summer Solstice. Its golden threads shine with the light of the sun.
A ring forged by the mad god in the flames of the suns surface. Its magic protects its owner from some harm. Original Design by DieGo.
A bow of light forged by the angels for use in their eternal struggle against darkness and evil.
A sword that, when held by one true of heart, will release magic from the flawless ruby in its hilt and ignite in flames.
A dagger imbued with Amethyst magic to protect its owner from harm.
An odd energy source known for the amazing ability to fire hats.
Meow! Meow meow meow! MEOWMEOWMEOW.
Made by a pretty lazy wizard. Hope it makes something worthwhile.
Created by a lonely Sorcerer. This sentient eye doesn't make a very good friend. It does, however, make fruit.
This was all the rage a few Winter Solstices ago.
The Devil - Card XV of the Major Arcana.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
The Sun - Card XIX of the Major Arcana.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
Death - Card XIII of the Major Arcana.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
The Tower - Card XVI of the Major Arcana.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
The Magician - Card I of the Major Arcana.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
The World - Card XXI of the Major Arcana.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
The Chariot - Card VII of the Major Arcana.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
The Moon - Card XVIII of the Major Arcana.\n\nSprite Credits: LabdaABeta
The Fool - Card 0 or XXII of the Major Arcana. The fool represents innocence, it is the beginning. When inverted, the fool represents recklessness.
A festive piece of armor, complete with bells. Try not to get too crazy.
A piece of heavy plate mail forged in the dungeons of Oryx's castle, it is decorated with dark red Almandine stones.
Set with stones as red as Oryx's favorite Cabernet Sauvignon.

object.id: Onyx Shield of the Mad God
object.description: A pitch-black shield looted from the depths of Oryx's Castle.
A detailed sword crafted out of blackened metal and precious bloodstone by Oryx's minions as a tribute to their overlord.
This wand has been used countless times to raise Lord Ruthven from the dead.
A claw-shard from Feargus, the Obsidian Dragon.
You can hear the screams of tortured souls as you draw this bow.
It seems to dispense special runes upon use. Perhaps...some things are better left unknown.
This blade is drenched in the blood of heroes. Are you sure this blade is meant for you?
A potion that permanently increases attack power by 2.
A potion that permanently increases defense power by 2.
A potion that permanently increases speed by 2.
A potion that permanently increases vitality by 2.
A potion that permanently increases wisdom by 2.
A potion that permanently increases dexterity by 2.
A potion that permanently increases health by 10.
A potion that permanently increases magic by 10.
A piece of Halloween candy that restores health and magic points.
Perhaps all that remains of Esben, whoever he was.\n\nSprite Credits: Pfiffel
The skull still seems to contain some of the Void Entity's power.
A ceremonial garment worn by those who worship the god Geb.
It is said that the ring attunes its wearer to the earth and its life force.
Within, the priests of the past have catalogued the story and knowledge of Geb.
Despite their normal pacificity, priests of Geb were able to protect themselves from aggressors.
...finally, I cornered and killed the beast. When I awoke in a cold sweat...I felt youthful, powerful.
As I lifted the stone from its resting place it became readily apparent there was more to it than met the eye...
All shall know my power. Not even the Mad God can stop me.
I was a fool before, but now everything is so clear. The phylactery speaks to me, knows me, protects me.
Pixies are often a more aggressive fae. It makes great sense that they would provide heroes with swords as fine as this.

object.id: Legacy Seal of the Enchanted Forest
object.displayid: Legacy Seal of the Enchanted Forest
object.description: Protect the helpless, embolden the heroic, slow the progress of evil. - Inscription, in Fae.
This colorful platemail is enchanted with special protections, a gift from the kind fairies that dwell in the Realm.
Many do not realize how powerful a kind wish is.
Made of a strange metal not known to the living.
He does not kill his victims. He becomes them.
Woven from the skin of a ghast, it cannot be seen...except by the user.
Though the whispers can be heard in your head, they're not THAT loud.
Made of a strange metal not known to the living. Its connection to the spirit plane causes a high pitched shriek as it slashes.
Woven from the skin of a ghast, Skuld's ability to freely shift between the mortal and spiritual plane is linked to this cloak's unusual fabric.
With little need for conventional armor, Skuld prefers to empower her magic arts even further.
The charm embedded into this ring grants the power to absorb and redirect souls for placement in the afterlife.
While it may be alive, it can't speak. But, it CAN kill.
Magical blasts can be blocked by armor, but true fear will pierce their hides and strike their heart.
On simple observation this robe has known many owners. All are dead.
An unsettling glow looms beneath the ancient gem's surface. Soon enough its power will be unleashed again.

This transmogrified crook bolsters the ability to peer into pocket dimensions and cling to the essence within. Such a characteristic arguably makes the staff itself sentient, a harrowing trait for the tool which gave the Shattered Kingdom its name.

A cryptic scroll from the castle archives, unlike anything else in the forsaken collection. Only with supreme occult power may one harness the equalized power of the immortal elements, a technique long attributed to mere legend.

effectinfo.description: Summon Inferno and Blizzard for 4.8 seconds.

object.description: On simple observation, this robe appears unremarkably standard for the dressings of the court magician. But perhaps this attribute is all too emblematic of kingdom's folly.

effectinfo.description: Restore 100 mana when In Combat below 50% MP
effectinfo.name: On Shoot

object.description: An unsettling glow looms beneath the partitioned gem's surface, ever-changing yet always in immaculate balance. Soon enough its power may be unleashed again.

effectinfo.description: Wearing Ancient Eminence along with this ring allows you to summon Blizzard and Inferno for 4.8 seconds.

object.description: All initiates who start the path of becoming a Dragon Tamer are given a special weapon. If an initiate completes the Path alive, this weapon is given a name by the Elders.
The last piece of the Taming ritual requires a man to be bound to a Dragon. Wizards were able to link a man to a Dragon's spirit using magic and pain. Using its powers comes with a great cost.
Made from the Heart of Zaarvox by Ulricht the first Dragon Tamer.
Given to the initiates who survive the first challenge.
My staff led me to a strange arena, which seemed to have a dark aura about it.
I found a great spectre floating above me. He reached out and granted me his cranium.
His gift was gracious, but I would not dabble in spirits. He challenged me to a duel.
Our fight was glorious, but in the end, I fell in battle and joined him in undeath.
You are not a unique snowflake. You're like one of five or something.
So hot, it's cool. The unique combo of hot and cold elements allows it to generate devastating ice attacks.
How else would the minions of Oryx get their gifts?\n\nSprite Credits: paulo and sonutx
Crude, but effective.
Fa la la la la, la la la la.
The metal is icy cold to the touch and delivers a biting sting upon cutting.
Lets you choose and change the physical form of your pet.\nYou must be in the pet yard to use it.
Ready to dupe?
Its irregular shape makes it hard to get a grip on this burning poison.
An astronomically heavy katana. It is forged from dark matter.
A deadly substance concocted with ingredients found in the sewers.
A yummy treat.
Stolen from the Queen Bee herself, this scepter possesses the power to destroy evil.
A magical honeycomb that was once crucial in repelling an assault from the Hornet Rebellion.
What's in the box? Crank the handle and find out!
Seemingly bleak at first, this prism has erratic magical properties looming inside, which affect the light it scatters in unforeseen ways.
A shield from a place beyond the gates of war and peace.
An intricate scepter of unfathomable power containing the electric fluids of a jellyfish behemoth.
A youthful jellyfish taken from the reefs of the ocean realms, residing within a coralglass jar.

effectinfo.description: 1.5 seconds to throw and lasts 3 seconds

object.description: Because what kind of monster would trick their fellows with a fake one?
Unlocks a character slot! Once activated, do not change maps before the confirmation message appears or the item might disappear!
Unlocks a vault chest! Once activated, do not change maps before the confirmation message appears or the item might disappear!
From the realms of frost, this wand's ice magic penetrates even the strongest armor.
Corrupted by creatures of the frost realms, its arrows will slacken assailants promptly.
It's healthy!\nInstantly grants level 20. Permanently increases attack, defense, speed, dexterity, vitality and wisdom by 20. Also adds a Backpack. Only usable once per character.
Instantly grants level 20.
Spawns 500 Fame worth of chicken! Also functions as high quality pet food. Yum!\n\nConsume responsibly!
Ultimate Feed Power.
Grants 40000000 EXP (~20000 Fame).
Summon a trail of buddies that follow you around.
A lightweight blade, imbued with frosty runes.\n\nSprite Credits: Poshun
A frozen staff, used for creating powerful chilly blasts around the user.\n\nSprite Credits: Poshun
A cool wand that creates a flurry of beautiful snowflakes.\n\nSprite Credits: Poshun
A bow, fashioned from solid ice, enchanted not to melt. It's often used by elven hunters of the arctic wastes.\n\nSprite Credits: Poshun
Protective leather armor fashioned from the frozen, but resilient scales of a frost drake.\n\nSprite Credits: Poshun
An excellent robe, woven from icy threads. It's typically only worn by the most adept ice mages.\n\nSprite Credits: Poshun
An ancient artifact, once worn by a corrupt king of the frost realms.\n\nSprite Credits: Poshun
A sturdy suit of armor, reinforced with ice plating. It's worn by the bravest warriors known to challenge the Mad God.\n\nSprite Credits: Poshun
A tome that allows the caster to encase themselves in extremely durable ice. However, despite being nearly impenetrable, it will melt after a while.\n\nSprite Credits: Poshun

A relic from an age when evil chickens had taken over the realm. Their tyranny ended eventually at the hands of an exceptional wielder of the dirk.
Made from a cherry tree branch. This wand was gifted by Xil to Daichi for bringing him into this world.
Imbued with haunting energies of a foreign rite, the layered blade of this shadowy tool is never finished with its victim.
An incredible dagger forged from the teeth of a murderous rabbit, it has the incredible power to summon angry rabbits.
Made from the remains of a violent bunny, whoever wears this helm is given the magical ability to hop as fast as a bunny!
A bizzare spell fabricated by a powerful bunny magician, they don't only do trick shows inside those magic hats!
Good thing this bow is lucky because it sure doesn't hit very hard!\n\nSprite Credits: Beige
Colorful and fashionable, but not very good for hunting monsters.\n\nSprite Credits: Beige
Create your own rainbow!\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Use that clover to impress the ladies.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
This viscous concoction was robbed from the Killer Bees, and its venomous properties have been cleansed. Its remaining strength seems to come from an unknown ingredient.
The blade of this dagger was once the enormous Killer Bee Queen's stinger. It remains exceptionally sharp, and could easily cut through even the heaviest of armor in a single strike.
A nefarious helm combining pheromones and Killer Honey to captivate Killer Bees into servitude.

effectinfo.description: Summon 3 bees to aid you in combat for 6 seconds

effectinfo.name: Red Bee Effect
effectinfo.description: Inflicts Curse for 4 seconds after being active for 1.6 seconds.

object.description: A quiver crafted from the remains of a yellow Beehemoth, filled with razor-sharp arrows fashioned from Killer Bee stingers.
A quiver crafted from the remains of a red Beehemoth, filled with razor-sharp arrows fashioned from Killer Bee stingers.
A quiver crafted from the remains of a blue Beehemoth, filled with razor-sharp arrows fashioned from Killer Bee stingers.
Chitin armor fashioned from the exoskeleton of a yellow Beehemoth. Ultra-light and extremely flexible, yet surprisingly tough.
Chitin armor fashioned from the exoskeleton of a red Beehemoth. Ultra-light and extremely flexible, yet surprisingly tough.
Chitin armor fashioned from the exoskeleton of a blue Beehemoth. Ultra-light and extremely flexible, yet surprisingly tough.
A flexible ironwax bow created by the Felwasp Guards to defend their larvae from assailants.
A strange trap that subdues would-be pilferers with a torrent of sticky honey.
Lightweight, yet protective armor taken from the shed exoskeleton of a warrior bee.
The solid honey on this ring renews its wearer with incredible energy.
Remove Accessory Dye
Remove Clothing Dye
Remove Accessory Dye from your character. Magical properties give the item unlimited use.
Remove Clothing Dye from your character. Magical properties give the item unlimited use.
A makeshift dagger hastily crafted from the debris of a fallen golem. It may be blunt, but it is also very lightweight.
A fragment of a brain from a lesser golem. Its strength indicates it came from a Golem of Anger.
Formed of the tissue surrounding a golem core.
Used to bind aggressive golems. Considering they are no longer attached, they do not appear to have been very effective.
A seal made from the Marble Colossus' head. The power of a pure and mighty paladin still remains within.

effectinfo.description: Summon an Eye of Marble for 4.5 seconds

object.description: A commanding staff used by vile cult leaders. It has a strange force inside it that prevents it from facing forward of the user.
An oddly heavy vial found within the undergrounds of the Lost Halls. It is said to contain the embodiment of Evil itself.
A pile of eroded rock from the Lost Halls. A hint of magic remains within.
Every shot that hits a target frees the soul of a forgotten hero. Every shot that misses is trapped for eternity.
A mysterious quiver formed of corruption and dark matter. Its ethereal existence creates a small implosion of nearby atmosphere when drawn.
This armor does not deflect projectiles like most materials known to man. It absorbs and engulfs them, sending them to a new plane of reality.
Unknown.
An unfathomable amount of strength pulses through this ring. Only the most righteous mortals can touch this ring and live.
The cursed skull of a corrupted mind. Good intentions can go horribly wrong.
A thin hood with a faded golden lace worn for sacrificial ceremonies. It has an aura of evil around it.
A seemingly shattered ring that keeps itself together with an unknown magnetic force. It only stays together on the finger of a true killer.
A sword with an impossibly sharp edge. It has been designed with holy magic to slash like no other blade.
A fine sheet of marble charged with the same energy that powers the Marble Colossus. What it lacks in physical durability, it makes up for with a life-breathing aura.
The source of power for the Marble Colossus found within his core. It is intended to give life to golems, but it can provide benefits to the living as well.
Many Rogues have tried to use this to escape their asylum. All have failed.
A medallion infused with the essence of Septavius the Ghost God.

Believed to have been lost in a bygone era, this spell was recovered from ruins infested by horrific creatures of unknown origin. The scroll is still steeped with parasitic organisms.
An ancient tome covered with fleshy appendages. It contains the secrets to magic often considered blasphemous by priests, used to inflict horrible pain on others.
A loathsome scepter that converges the life energy of parasites into a soul-rotting bolt of destruction.
Armaw? xD
A holy shepherd's hook that creates sacred light to guide the innocent to salvation.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A skillfully decorated snowglobe that is actually a warlock's sinister tool of inquisition, imprisoning foes in a realm of infinite winter.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A finely sculpted helm worn by commanders of the northern realms, its enormous display of regal antlers make their authorative presense known in the chaos of war.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A giant sock-like quiver woven from elventhread, concentrating evil energy into a lump of coal to create powerful arrows.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A monstrous skull hewed with incantations of darkness to absorb life energy from the souls of the wicked.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A seraphic wardspell that burns the unworthy with molten wax from the heavenly vigil.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A seemingly harmless present that actually contains a magical hyperspace pocket stuffed to the brim with explosives and shrapnel.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
An enormous, brazen shield taken from an ancient belfry, long believed to have been enchanted by centuries of ringing for angelic favor.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A brilliantly shining prism of berylstone, cut to resemble a tree topper as a means of hiding eidolon agents in plain sight.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A most holy manuscript taken from an ancient celestial library, brimming with golden light that wrests the innocent from the clutches of death.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
The bitter poison of evergreen berries that has also absorbed a great deal of energy from evil spirits.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A snug cloak crafted by a band of seclusive snowthieves to help pilfer riches and disappear into the heart of winter.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A sacred seal of the bitter Frost Kingdoms, bearing a wreathlike design that invokes a symbol of strength and endurance in the midst of winter.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A razor-sharp arrangement of holly plants that has been enchanted to vanquish spirits of darkness.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron

This Orb creates a concentrated area of energy. The energy is so dense at its core that foes are paralyzed.
Although destroyed, the beast's brute strength remains deeply embedded in this odd wand. Its rage possesses you, and lends you its force.
A scepter that can be evoked to unleash overwhelmingly powerful blasts upon others. Even the most crazed scientists wouldn't use this scepter without taking note of its side effects.
A rigid hide, chemically engineered by Dr. Terrible and reinforced with rough scales. Though torn apart during battle, it remains powerful.
Fetid claws imbued with dangerous chemicals, pulled from the Horrific Creation.
This taco is spicy!
This taco is so hot it can melt steel beams.
Not for human consumption. Only a god... or your pet... can eat this!
Malphas' special! Combine with Tacos at the Tinkerer for some explosive Pet Food!
A refreshing beverage that temporarily boosts your stats. Goes well with lime!
The melding of these creatures and their host is one of pain and suffering.
Swarming cells fill this jar, prepared to bind to whatever may foolishly approach them.
The parasites wait until the most opportune time, then strike at their targets. They become hosts to a greater evil.
The parasites are not individual beings; they share a single consciousness.

Exchange July Monthly Shards each day at the Tinkerer during the month. Complete this daily quest for 10 days this month to receive the Anubis Necromancer Skin!
Temporarily transform players around you to Deca mini Djinjas!
This strange weapon sometimes affects the size of surrounding creatures.
Omae wa...
When you have this hammer, you don't need a reason to use it.
A grand scroll capable of summoning sharpened emerald shards, slicing through even the most durable opponent.
A pitch black cloak enhanced with the defensive strength of Oryx's own signature armor.
This shimmering shield allows knights to enhance their concentration on targets, giving them more time to think about their next move in battle.
A Katana made to harness the energy of the Wind.
While being made of soft fabric, this outfit is mysteriously sturdy.
The first and last teardrop of the ominous fiery demon.
Calls upon old energy to unleash a swarm of dragon like energy spirits.
Adult male basilisks are apex predators, and at full maturity their tails gain the unique ability to release piercing acid from the tip.
An undamaged version of a well known archaeological artifact, radiating a potent dark energy. This rare find is coveted by many explorers.
The Tlatoani used this robe to aid them in casting their most powerful magic spells. Like their other ceremonial garbs, it rarely saw much combat application.
This spell's destructive power is so notorious that casting it was banned for many generations.
What's in the box?

Skuld enchanted this signature armor by channeling Oryx's relentless rage into its metal plates. This aura of anger now grants the strength of unbridled fury to anyone reckless enough to wear it themselves.
It is believed that Oryx siphons a drop of blood from each hero he slays for use in this intimidating crimson ring.

This almighty shield was specially designed to protect its owner from a bombardment of attacks in all directions. Although feared today, it once stood as a reminder of Oryx's glory in an era long forgotten.
Forged eons ago in the fires of Shaitan's domain, this infamous blade has cut down countless mighty heroes throughout the ages.
"Very rich in calcium!" - Dr. Terrible.
This artifact is the result of a forbidden spell. It is made of crystalized blood.
This orb has been imbued by Skuld with the energy of the lost souls wandering her Cemetery.
A delicious way to celebrate the holiday!
Ha! No more wandering around!
With chocolate filling!
Is this snow or powdered sugar? I could eat both!
A wakizashi fashioned from perennial ice. Its innocent, festive appearance belies its lethal edge.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
This tome was carried to battle by the members of a forgotten order.
This helm was worn by the elite guardians of a long lost empire.
The Paladins of Lira-Tin used this seal to reach high level of focus during their training.
The still-beating heart of a mysterious Server. It could be supremely powerful if it were a little more stable, and perhaps less starchy.
A revered bow hidden away for many years by those wise enough to recognize the danger of its devestating might. Its strength is unmatched throughout the universe.
Royal alchemy techniques have enabled this quiver to sharpen the gilded tips held within. Arrows loosed from the case are recognized as some of the sharpest objects known to man.
An illustrious lineage of acclaimed bowmen have passed down this famed attire. It boasts such immense defensive power that its wearer is considered invincible.
A legendary citrine ring said to grant unfathomable amounts of dexterity to those who possess it.
A highly unstable staff engineered to expel forceful bolts of an energy component known as K.I.D.D. (Knee-deep In Dungeon Design). It's not great now, but allegedly the second version will be better.
A heavy mace that abides only by the power of repetition.
Displaying this malformed mango in public is said to awaken the rage of a long-dormant entity from beyond.
Crispy, buttered, wheat or rye. In toast it lives, in toast it dies.
The harbinger of past pandemonium, current craziness, and future fatuity. It just can't seem to stay focused.
A katana once belonging to a royal sorcerer known for great ambition, but slow delivery. His treasured blade was prophesied to produce something wonderful... eventually.
A brilliant cloak that utilizes the complex process of light reflection to perfectly conceal its user by creating an exact replica, mimicking the wearer.
A quiver once treasured by a highly sentimental archer who just couldn't bear to part with her arrows forever. They've become rather dull after so much recycling.
An instructional spell used as an education tool for the training of young wizards. Before they run, they must learn to talk.

The deepest wounds are not physical, but psychological. Only the wisest healers are savvy enough to apply the advanced treatment this tome enables, guaranteed to revitalize allies in their times of need.

It's not easy being the best. Some wish for more, a way to inflict difficulties on themselves so that they may once again experience what it's like to not be insultingly overpowered. At last, there is a way.
As the heavy armor worn by most knights typically conceals their faces with a stoic expression, they require other ways to convey emotions of shock or excitement.

The fruit of over a decade of research, this blessed seal at long last overcomes all limitations on its usage and never allows its user to run out of strength. A slight concession had to be made by devoting one hundred percent of its magic resources back into magic.

A misguided attempt by Xolotl to grant a form of his power to followers among the Secluded Thicket, with the glaring weakness that it can only be utilized in large, open areas with direct access to the clouds.
The skull of an enlightened philosopher who understood the true potential of necromancers to be summoners. Tragically, his overwhelmingly high IQ got the best of him.

effectinfo.description: Summons a mind minion to enlighten foes
effectinfo.name: Epiphany Summon

object.description: A devastating trap with some major hang time. It's full of hot air and not actually that useful, which is surely a metaphor for something.
What goes around comes around.
All that glitters is not gold. Beware, tricksters who choose this dastardly prism must be committed to their cruel prank.

object.description: After years of the truth being rejected by the masses, this version of the fabled Honey Scepter is automatically enhanced with the full potential it had all along.

effectinfo.description: Converts you to a Honey Scepter Acolyte for 60 seconds

object.description: A star with high potential, but curses the user with a crippling lack of decisiveness.
A double-edged wakizashi that exposes in more ways than one.
An unfathomable lack of strength is found in this ring. Only the most unreasonable mortals would ever consider voluntarily handicapping themselves so aggressively.
First summer storm cloud\nInflicting a thousand cuts\nBrilliance, then ash.
Circle of sunlight\nEmpowers a fragile bloom\nAnd scours the world.
Scarf held to the breeze\nCommanding a storm's vengeance\nHoping for silence.
Spiraling treasure\nPrayer beads for the downpour\nCoiled in grateful hands.
Distinguished archers are permitted to take their prized bow with them to the afterlife. It conjures ethereal arrows when drawn, penetrating the very souls of living beings.
A quiver not meant for the corporeal realm. When used by a mortal, it creates a momentary rift between death and life, briefly releasing the chilling screams of the lost.
An enduring garment of spectral steel worn by the shades of the shadows.
An otherworldly gemstone is set in this oddly tight ring. It does not seem designed for human fingers.
A whimsical wakizashi of Eastern origin; it has a pleasant aroma of cherry blossoms.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

A fragment of Lord Ruthven's curse manifest itself into this pulsating dagger. Its formless state allows it to cut in ways no other weapon could.

object.description: A rod composed of solid foramite, the only known material in the galaxy capable of withstanding the corrosive effects of Foraxian acid.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
An irregular fragment of a fiery comet that once passed over Malogia. Intergalatic legends know it as the herald of the great alien lord Nizos.\n\nSprite Credits: Trensient
One of the most unusual feats of Katalonian engineering. This barely tangible sword hurls puffs of toxic gas, if you can manage to firmly grasp it.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Steeped in the acid rainwater of Forax, the chemical coating has transformed this already mighty blade into a heavy-hitting weapon of war.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Though rather unremarkable as far as alien weapons go, Malogian clans swear by this weapon as a good luck charm. Some things never change.
The frigid landscape of Untaris is chilled by the moonlight reflected from a planet of astral frost.\n\nSprite Credits: Trensient
A stunning bow forged in the heat of a massive star many lightyears beyond the realm.
The abnormal alignment of Malogia's moons block direct light from its sun during most of its revolution. The brief periods of visiblity are ferociously hot.\n\nSprite Credits: Artauris

Interestingly, freezing the acid of Forax into a solid material retains its burning properties. Crafty alien mercenaries have used this to create brutal assassination weapons such as this.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A set of daggers given partial sentience by alien technology. They fiercely compete to claim more kills than the other.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
An accomplished alien conquerer brandished this wand as a show of might, topping it with a gemstone from each planet he overthrew.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A wand held together by an ice crystal extracted from the depths of Untaris. Each shot possesses the concentrated force of a blizzard.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Contains a random weapon from Forax.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Contains a random weapon from Katalund.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Contains a random weapon from Untaris.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Contains a random weapon from Malogia.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Contains a random alien weapon.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.description: Summon one Dragon Soul randomly, providing one aura effect out of the following

object.description: An aged stone vessel containing a fragment of an elemental power. Unlike modern glass bottles, this opaque container means that the contents cannot be seen until the potion is opened.
Imagine someone leaving that on your kitchen table.\n\nSprite Credits: Artauris
Aliens have turned Oryx into a chocolate-filled cookie! But mmm... it's delicious!\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
That's why you don't task aliens to prepare your birthday cake....\n\nSprite Credits: Artauris
Raises your energy levels to the moon and back!\n\nSprite Credits: Artauris
Grants a Summer Skin when used!
A long-lost druid's tome that catalogs medicinal mushrooms. It also has many pocket spaces that contain spore samples, which can be made fully grown through incantations.

effectinfo.description: Create a Healing Mushroom that lasts 3 seconds.

object.description: An ancient druidic spell that invokes earth spirits into furnishing the soil with a noxious, deadly skullshroom colony.

effectinfo.description: Creates a Deadly Mushroom that lasts 4.8 seconds.

object.description: The fungus covering this armor has eaten away all the metal. While offering little protection, its restorative powers make this armor unique.

effectinfo.name: Second activation
effectinfo.description: Teleport back to the marked location.

effectinfo.name: Note
effectinfo.description: Mark is reset upon changing area or after 30 seconds.

object.description: A fragmented prism that is constantly mending its cracks and refracturing. Pulling pieces apart can create an unstable link between two spaces as the prism tries to become whole again.
An ornately decorated buckler made from an array of crystalline stone. It is too frail to swing around, but it can somehow grow and mantle its wielder in an indestructible crystal armor.
Even in small amounts, this potent venom is capable of corroding the armor of its victims.
This strange trinket creates a cloud of crystaline particles rendering anyone inside invisible.
A ceremonial trap used by the elite members of the Mushroom Tribes to ensnare those who trespass their sacred sanctum.

effectinfo.name: Trap
effectinfo.description: Spawn a Crystal Sentry for 5 seconds

effectinfo.name: Crystal Sentry
effectinfo.description: Deals 350 damage to the closest target within 8 sqrs every 0.8 seconds

object.description: This heavy cloak cleverly conceals its user not by magic, but by channeling the light around them as camouflage. Tampering with this light briefly projects a false mirror image of oneself.

effectinfo.name: Summon
effectinfo.description: 3 Mirror Images, the outer two orbit the center and fire shots inwards and outwards

object.description: Carved from the unblemished minerals deep beneath the realm, this unconventional wakizashi fractures itself when swung to release a strange supernatural energy.

effectinfo.description: Summons sentient crystal star orbiting you for 5 seconds
Inflicts Exposed for 4 seconds, deals 350 damage per hit
effectinfo.name: Crystal Star

object.description: A perfectly cut crystal encasing light from the oldest stars in the universe. All who hold it are filled with a sense of peace and concentration.
A medallion infused with the essence of Crystal Entity.

effectinfo.name: Drop location
effectinfo.description: Obtained by defeating the Crystal Entity in the Crystal Cavern

object.description: An even luckier shamrock that will make enemies drop more and better loot! Lasts 60 minutes.
Exchange this Bronze Chest for a good reward of choice at the Tinkerer!
Exchange this Silver Chest for an amazing reward of choice at the Tinkerer!
Exchange this Gold Chest for a mind-blowing reward of choice at the Tinkerer!
Exchange this Platinum Chest for an out-of-this-world reward of choice at the Tinkerer!
A magical chain of infinite keys capable of unlocking the secrets of the universe, though your mileage may vary. Not to be confused with a different key-related blade.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A mysterious key bestowed upon the Keyper by the Crystal Entity, imbued with an aura of forbidden magic. It fits no locks, yet it can open anything.\n\nSprite Credits: Trensient

effectinfo.description: Releases a barrage of 10 keys to hinder opponents.
effectinfo.name: Keyper's Trickery

object.description: A crystal trap with a built-in luring mechanism. The perimeter of the trap reflects light toward the center to create an illusionary mimic.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.description: Creates a centered decoy for 1 second.
effectinfo.name: Trap

object.description: The perfectly cut head of a Prismimic, dastardly agents of the Crystal Entity. Its copying abilities are unprecedented.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.description: Creates an expanding ring of 8 decoys

object.description: A brutally heavy sword designed to make those at the other end of its blade know their place.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Granted only to the highest ranking mages of Oryx's legion, this wand conjures pagan magic forbidden by most practitioners.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Not one for long distance combat himself, Oryx leaves archery training in the hands of former realm heroes who defected to his side.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

The Mad God knows the value of cloak and dagger operations, despite his personal inclination toward more overt tactics. Oryx's minions consider it a great honor to be gifted this dagger.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Initially built solely for Oryx's reckless use, the construction of this staff proved potent enough to mass produce for Oryx's champions.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Though Oryx is only known to deploy his assassin units in times of personal need, the deliberately cruel craftsmanship of their katanas is no less remarkable.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Using real corn as a weapon proved to be counterintuitive, so it was substituted with candy corn. Surprisingly, this only worsened the crow problem.\n\nSprite Credits: Bonk, Aurum
The innards of a pumpkin were molded into this pile that vaguely resembles a prism. Used only by the laziest scarecrows who feel the need to outsource their job.\n\nSprite Credits: Bonk, Aurum
Once worn by a remarkably ineffective scarecrow who was regularly swarmed by the very thing it swore to destroy.\n\nSprite Credits: Bonk, Aurum
A humble hat with some dirt and straw stuck between the cloth. Being a scarecrow ain't much, but it's honest work.\n\nSprite Credits: Bonk, Aurum
A rib strung together by a tendon, sure to send shivers down your enemy's spines.\n\nSprite Credits: Tero, Aurum
The sternum of a long deceased adventurer. It releases a shriek when fired, making enemies shake and shudder in surprise.\n\nSprite Credits: Tero, Aurum
A rather bare bones armor affording more protection than one would expect. This bag of bones seems so unsafe.\n\nSprite Credits: Tero, Aurum
There's a certain irony to this macabre amulet. It's not very comfortable to wear and will seldom let you snooze.\n\nSprite Credits: Tero, Aurum
A merciless blade forged in the intense fires of the realm's core, designed for use by great demon lords.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Paladins must take an oath of righteousness to obtain their titles. Those who defect are considered deeply cursed.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A cruel armor stitched from the victims of demonic killers, a symbol of one's ruthlessness.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
The severed head of an imp grew horns posthumously, an eerie piece of natural decor.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A blued wooden staff lit with an undying flame. Only an extraordinarily skilled sorceress can wield the fire without this attachment.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A crystal ball known to be able to summon magically constructed bats, but this technique has only been mastered by Totalia's kind.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Totalia's garbs are specially fitted to be flexible enough to ride brooms. The cloth is also flame retardant, a quality which proved essential after more than one incident.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
The true source of Totalia's powers. This ornament contains a small amount of liquid freely moving inside. It's cold-hot-fresh!\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A necessary component for any beer-drinking or sausage-eating in the month of October.\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron

While working in a lab late one night, a wizard beheld an eerie sight.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
The ghouls all came from their humble abodes to get a jolt from his electrodes.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.description: Summon Animated Staff and Spectral Skull for 4.8 seconds.

object.description: The scene was rocking, all were digging the sounds. Igor on chains, backed by his baying hounds.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.description: Restore 100 mana when In Combat below 50% MP

object.description: Everything was cool, Ruthven's a part of the band. And his monster mash was the hit of the land.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.description: Wearing Spectral Spell along with this ring allows you to summon Animated Staff and Spectral Skull for 4.8 seconds.

object.description: A rich caramel coating on a tart Granny Smith apple.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
If the candy didn't rot your teeth, this sure will!\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A sugar-coated gummy delight! Except for when somebody replaces it with an actual worm.\n\nSprite Credits: Lily
Taste the Rainbow Gummy Worm... feel the Rainbow Gummy Worm!\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
What an eyesore!\n\nSprite Credits: Lily
People afraid of tricks will usually give this to you. It's delicious!\n\nSprite Credits: Trensient

A short lived dirk which saw little use in the hands of a quickly slain adventurer, too lucky for their own good. Knowing its purpose was left unfulfilled, it seeks to eliminate the evil chicken menace from beyond the grave.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
"Very rich in calcium!" - Dr. Terrible.\n\nSprite Credits: CrystalPX

Oryx's so-called priests use cruel wands like this to inflict suffering on their recipients. They themselves must endure this pain to begin the path to consecration.
Those who wish to be hallowed among Oryx's legion are required to drink the wretched concoction within this chalice, a mix between the Mad God's poorly kept wine and his own sentient bile.

effectinfo.description: 1% chance to become Drunk for 2 seconds after taking at least 50 damage.
effectinfo.name: Sommelier's Gamble

object.description: Knowing they are to serve a more aggressive purpose on the front lines, Oryx's chosen messengers utilize a plated robe, complete with a crimson cape.
When the arduous path to anointment is complete, the priest is decorated with this symbolic ring of servitude, modeled after Oryx's famed warriors.
Decorated with the finest flora of the realm's toughest forests, this bow uses the sharp cymes of plant life as arrows against would-be vandalizers.
Sprouted and plucked from an ancient, enchanted riverbank, this flower's spores weaken the roots of evil and strengthen righteous hearts.

effectinfo.description: Trap inflicts Healing and Berserk upon players for 4 seconds.
effectinfo.name: Woodland Blessing

object.description: A lightweight floral coat fitted with the molted shell of a colossal insect. The energy of its evolution still pulses through, reacting upon blows.

effectinfo.description: 10% chance to receive +10 dexterity for 5 seconds on taking damage.
effectinfo.name: Green Thumb

object.description: Expertly carved from ancient trees and fitted together with their sap, this ring's flowers have absorbed magical energy over many years, storing it within its fruit.
A clumsy yet vicious weapon favored by marauders from coast to coast. Only an experienced pirate king can perform the techniques required to unlock its full potential.
Pirate captains wear extravagant cocked hats to both inspire their men and intimidate their foes.

effectinfo.description: Fires cannonballs when hit for at least 40 damage.
effectinfo.name: Cannon Cluster

object.description: The buccaneers that raided the realm before Oryx's rule famously wore such attire. Its opulence does not make for the most practical choice when sailing, but it was valued as a status symbol.
Less prominent pirates use personal hooks to signify their rank. Though it is almost entirely symbolic on its own, no true pirate is complete without one.

Open it to get one of the following:

*Fiery Katana
*Pyro Sheath
*Flame Guard
*Firelight Necklace

*Loot Tier Potion

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A dapper silk hat, suspiciously owned by a band of pirates with no interest in such class.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A dapper silk hat, said to be worn as a crown by the numerous snakes in Stheno's hair.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A dapper silk hat, taken to the abyssal depths by wealthy aristocrat who thought himself too noble to die.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A dapper silk hat, once belonging to a captive of Davy's crew who went down with the vessel.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A dapper silk hat, donned by a childlike man in his grand voyage to the corner of the globe. It was a real trip.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A slightly unripe carrot that could make for a suitable nose. This one was grown in the depths of a jungle.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A slightly unripe carrot that could make for a suitable nose. Believe it or not, the dimension of sprites is home to a booming agriculture industry.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A slightly unripe carrot that could make for a suitable nose. This one was steeped in holy water, though the benefit of blessing a carrot is questionable.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A slightly unripe carrot that could make for a suitable nose. This is perhaps the only snowman accessory that makes any real sense.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: A slightly unripe carrot that could make for a suitable nose. It's a miracle that any kind of farming could be achieved in a soil-deficient environment so hostile toward crops.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: Two lumps of coal, or two crude eyes with some imagination. It's unclear what use spiders would have for coal in the first place.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: Two lumps of coal, or two crude eyes with some imagination. Even the cold, unfeeling undead need something to keep a fire burning.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: Two lumps of coal, or two crude eyes with some imagination. Skuld's simple-minded minions find this entertaining enough to be a toy.

effectinfo.description: Use with a snowman body to build your own Snowman!

object.description: Two lumps of coal, or two crude eyes with some imagination. The fleshy texture calls into question how much of this is actually coal.

object.description: Two lumps of coal, or two crude eyes with some imagination. Oryx's reluctant agreement with Limon prevents him from burning fossil fuels, making this coal of little value to him.

effectinfo.name: On Taking Damage
effectinfo.description: 10% chance to Slow enemies within 6 tiles for 5 seconds.

object.description: A glacial robe worn by the witch doctors of a bygone ice tribe during their sacred burial ceremonies. The passage of time has encased the cloth in a layer of permafrost, chilling those who fracture its coat.
A memento of a life long gone. You can still feel the warmth from years past through the frigid ice that has taken over.

effectinfo.description: Use in a realm to place a snowman body in the mountains, requires a hat, a nose and eyes to bring it to life!

object.description: A pile of snow, not yet fully decorated. Nature's blank canvas, though any would-be artists should be cautious of getting too carried away.

A blue ornament taken from Oryx's magical Oryxmas Tree. Inside, it contains the secrets to the past, which can be unleashed to gift its holder with the power of infinite possibilities.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.name: On Taking Damage
effectinfo.description: 10% chance to spawn an Oryxmas Tree that gives Energized to surrounding players and deals 50 damage to surrounding enemies every 0.2 seconds.

object.description: A yellow ornament taken from Oryx's magical Oryxmas Tree. The aura it emits fills even the bitterest of hearts with pure joy, causing their blows to land with less force than before.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.name: On Taking Damage
effectinfo.description: 10% chance to spawn an Oryxmas Tree that applies Weak to surrounding enemies and deals 50 damage every 0.2 seconds.

object.description: A red ornament taken from Oryx's magical Oryxmas Tree. It radiates with pure winter energy that highlights the weak spots of even the bulkiest of foes.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.name: On Taking Damage
effectinfo.description: 10% chance to spawn an Oryxmas Tree that applies Exposed to surrounding enemies and deals 50 damage every 0.2 seconds.

object.description: A majestic chain of ornaments, each holding astounding powers. If paired with enough essence of Oryxmas, it will gift the most righteous of hearts the absolute power of the winter.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.name: Oryxmas Unity
effectinfo.description: Gain strength based on the amount of Oryxmas gear you wear.

effectinfo.name: On Taking Damage
effectinfo.description: 10% chance to spawn an Oryxmas Tree that applies Exposed and Weak to surrounding enemies and Energized to surrounding players. It deals 50 damage to surrounding enemies every 0.2 seconds.

object.description: Merry Oryxmas! Open the box to receive a random Oryxmas Tier 13 Armor!
A present to share with friends during the Oryxmas Holidays!

effectinfo.name: Guild Present
effectinfo.description: This item can only be used in the Guild Hall. Once used, a present with rewards will spawn for all players in the Guild Hall.

object.description: Onyx armor forged for use by Oryx's famed champions, giving them a sample of Oryx's furious strength.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.name: Mad God's Rage
effectinfo.description: Gain 5 attack and dexterity for 3 seconds when hit under 80% HP.

object.description: Oryx's assassins use this flexible armor to remain agile as they harness the Mad God's power.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.name: Mad God's Rage
effectinfo.description: Gain 5 attack and dexterity for 3 seconds when hit under 80% HP.

object.description: The designated members of Oryx's court are fitted with this honorary robe, symbolizing their status among his legion.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

effectinfo.name: Mad God's Rage
effectinfo.description: Gain 5 attack and dexterity for 3 seconds when hit under 80% HP.

object.description: A glorious block of solid jade, sculpted to resemble a sacred scarab beetle from the time of the ancients. This extraordinarily rare relic was granted to mortal athletes by Bes, Nut, and Geb themselves in recognition of great swiftness.

With the enchantress reduced to ash, the stone burst, scattering the relics of the mystic into the realm's lava fissures. They have since awaited a daring hero to recover the pieces from the clutches of demons.
A suffocating black smoke began to pour out, consuming the young enchantress. As her soul and mind burned to dust, the fibers of this robe were strangely unscathed.
A young enchantress used a rare flame-absorbing stone to capture the lava spirits.

effectinfo.description: Stasis surrounding enemies when taking damage below 300 HP.
effectinfo.name: Heat Wave

object.description: In the primal era of the realm, the volcanic mountains were overrun with rampant lava spirits, spiteful creatures who sought to burn all they could touch.
What serves as the life support for all of the artificial creatures constructed by the Crystal Entity is also capable of bestowing strength and energy to organic life.
A devastating fracture in the center of this breathtaking armor tarnished its raw defensive abilities, but the dubious blessing of the Crystal Entity still allows it to aid the wearer in other ways.
These kunai were chiseled as an experimental weapon by the mineral monsters lurking far beneath the realm's surface.
Though its composition is merely a sharp crystal embedded in a rock, this naturally formed blade glistens with light, carving a path for its wielder to use.
A cursed gemstone imbued with numerous plagues. While unfavorable to one's stamina, it proves itself useful with the associated resistances.
A specially coated armor designed with the intent of nullifying illnesses. It is most beneficial when used in tandem with equipment of similar attributes.
Exposure to this ferocious concoction is so intensely lethal that it acts instantaneously. Its deceptively small vial allows for easy use.
An appalling dagger with a blade forged of a highly resilient metal, one of the very few materials that can withstand the corrosive properties surrounding it.

A crate which can be found only in the magma reservoir of a caldera volcano. Open it to get one of the following:

object.description: Bloomed from Belladonna's Garden, this plant has grown into a lethal weapon through its disc shape and exceptionally sharp petals. Its seeds fly off when thrown, quickly spreading itself through the surrounding area.\n\nSprite Credits: TLMaelstrom

effectinfo.description: Plants a Bud Bomb that explodes after 0.8 seconds
effectinfo.name: On Ability Use

object.description: Only until you find true love, will you know what sweet tenderness feels like.\n\nSprite Credits: Trensient
Dedicated to the one who will see beauty within.\n\nSprite Credits: Trensient
To my better half!\n\nSprite Credits: Trensient
Happy Valentine's Day! Open the box to receive one item of the Valentine's Day Archer Set!
Use this item near the Valentine's Heart encounter to spawn a companion that activate one of the hearts
A relic of the Tomb of the Ancients, once used by holy worshipers in ceremonies.\n\nSprite Credits: Beige
A gilded artifact discovered in the temple of El Dorado, presumably belonging to none other than Xolotl himself.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
An uncomfortably squishy piece of headgear that the Royal Cnidarian probably wants back.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
An ordinary mask covered in copious amounts of sludge from the Toxic Sewers.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
Use this to blast your enemies with an endless stream of light!\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A trap of solid light, pummeling your foes more vividly than ever before!\n\nSprite Credits: Dappertron
A vibrant blade brimming with the majesty and energy of double rainbows.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum
A lucky green staff complete with a crystallized clover, though only a real leprechaun could exercise its full power.\n\nSprite Credits: Aurum

It's healthy and nutritious!
Instantly grants level 20. Permanently increases attack, defense, speed, dexterity, vitality and wisdom by 5. Health and Magic by 25.

Sprite Credits: Aurusenth
Because what kind of monster would trick their fellows with a fake one?
A precious tome filled with botanical research. It speaks of floral remedies used by alchemists long ago to cleanse all ailments.\n\nSprite Credits: Lily
Open the bag to get a random April Fools skin!\n\nSprite Credits: Seelpit

object.description: A wicked rune of Oryx's shield, held by the most prominent minions Oryx trusts to guard his realm.

effectinfo.name: Usage
effectinfo.description: Activates the Shield Monument, one of three monuments needed to reach Oryx's Sanctuary.

effectinfo.name: Restoration
effectinfo.description: Upon deactivation of the Shield Monument, this item will be dropped on the ground.

activate.customstring: The Shield Monument has been activated

object.description: A wicked rune of Oryx's helmet, held by the Mad God's equally lethal rivals.

effectinfo.name: Usage
effectinfo.description: Activates the Helmet Monument, one of three monuments needed to reach Oryx's Sanctuary.

effectinfo.name: Restoration
effectinfo.description: Upon deactivation of the Helmet Monument, this item will be dropped on the ground.

activate.customstring: The Helmet Monument has been activated

object.description: A bronze ticket that gives you a chance to win an ST set of choice! Winners will be announced on Reddit!\n\nSprite Credits: LMaelstrom
A silver ticket that gives you a chance to win an ST set of choice! Winners will be announced on Reddit!\n\nSprite Credits: LMaelstrom
A golden ticket that gives you a chance to win an ST set of choice! Winners will be announced on Reddit!\n\nSprite Credits: LMaelstrom
A trophy awarded to all who were here during the Exalt Open Beta!\n\nSprite Credits: Aurusenth
This helm was forged of metal that fell from the sky. It is strangely light and emits a faint hum.
This helm was forged of metal that fell from the sky. It is strangely light and emits a faint hum.
This helm was forged of metal that fell from the sky. It is strangely light and emits a faint hum.
This strange quiver was created in a forgotten age by a lost tribe of Dark Elves.
This orb of ancient bloodstone has a dark reputation of twisting those who wield it.
Use with a special UT to give it a special effect.

effectinfo.name: Activation
effectinfo.description: Drag this shard on an Orb of Conflict to change its appearance. The new shiny UT will spawn in a bag next to you.
